text: *Die Haustür öffnet sich, Lucy kommt nach Hause*

Lucy: Bin zuhause!

Phoebe: Get out of my office, Lucy!
Lucy: What?!
Lucy: I'm just trying to help!
Phoebe: Yeah, well, you are not!
Lucy: Do you think it's fun to always see you struggling?
Lucy: To see how you let yourself down?
Lucy: I'm trying so hard to make you feel better and all I get is this angry frustration.
Lucy: I deserve better, Phoebe!
Lucy: You deserve better!

... a little later, in the living room...
Phoebe: Hey...
Lucy: Hey.
Lucy: Sit with me.
Lucy: Get some tea.
Phoebe: Lucy, I'm so sorry.
Lucy: It's okay.
Phoebe: No, it's not.
Phoebe: Please, listen.
Phoebe: I know you always want the best for me and I know you care. But sometimes...
Phoebe: Sometimes it feels like everything is too much.
Phoebe: Not you!
Phoebe: Just... everything.
Phoebe: And I feel so stupid about it. I feel like it should be easy. Like everyone is succeeding at life but me.
Phoebe: But I can't. I'm just sitting around, fumbling for the right words.
Phoebe: I...

Phoebe: I don't want to be a burden to you.
Lucy: You are not! Don't think that!
Lucy: I just want to understand what's going on.
Lucy: And I'm okay if you need some time to figure things out.
Lucy: But I want to be there. Even if you only need a hot beverage and maybe a cuddle.
ANSWER_HERE
Lucy: Sure. That's all I want.
Phoebe: But...
Phoebe: Don't get me wrong, Lucy. But I also need you to step down a little when I'm feeling bad.
Phoebe: I know you just want to help. And I love that.
Phoebe: But that's not how it works for me.
Lucy: I see.
Lucy: So, how can I help you?
Phoebe: I don't know.
Phoebe: I'm sorry I can't give you an answer. I don't know if I'll ever have one.
Phoebe: But maybe you can help me with that.
Lucy: I'd like that.
Lucy: As long as you let me know what you feel, I can handle it, you know? Even if you feel like being alone.
Lucy: I like you when you're happy and I like you when you're struggling.
Lucy: I love you, penguin.
Lucy: What do you mean?
Phoebe: I used to love my job.
Phoebe: Do you remember how excited I was when I first started?
Lucy: Of course I do. You kept telling me about that one game for weeks!
Phoebe: Yes! It was illustrated by-
Lucy: -your favorite artist in the whole wide world.
Lucy: I know. I love when you get excited over things.
Phoebe: Yeahâ€¦ but I havenâ€™t been in a while.
Phoebe: And at first I thought it was just me. Not being motivated enough. Just not good enough.
Phoebe: But it has been months now and I havenâ€™t felt content once.
Phoebe: I need to have this feeling back.
Phoebe: I need to know that Iâ€™m not... broken.

Lucy: We can figure something out about the money and we might not be able to do everything at once.
Lucy: But you need to start somewhere.

Phoebe: I mightâ€¦ maybeâ€¦ you could help me with some of these things?

Phoebe: What do you think, Lucy?

Lucy: We fell in love in October and I remember ice skating. It was so much fun!

Phoebe: It was all your fault!

Phoebe: I...
Phoebe: I just couldnâ€™t look away from you.
Phoebe: I love you, Lucy.
Phoebe: And I want to see the world with you. Not in a two weeks vacation.
Phoebe: I want to really see it and travel to all the icy places.
Phoebe: I want to drink hot chocolate in Iceland and kiss you in a snowstorm in the Alps.
Lucy: And throw a snowball at you in norway!
Phoebe: Yes. I want that.
Lucy: I want that too, penguin.
Phoebe: But I donâ€™t want you to think that Iâ€™m running away.
Phoebe: Snow was always my happy place.
Phoebe: And I think I need to make my mind a happy place again.
